intro: Eriochlamys cupularis, commonly known as the cupular wildflower, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stem is often hairy as well. Eriochlamys cupularis is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
